s2d.display

Class Display

  • java.lang.Object
    • s2d.display.Display

  • public class Display
extends java.lang.Object
    A window which handles mouse and keyboard input as well as rendering tasks.
    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Sina Ghaffari

    • Method Detail

      • createDisplay

        public static void createDisplay(int w,
                                 int h)
        Creates and opens a display.
        Parameters:
        w - Width of the display.
        h - Height of the display.

      • getGraphics

        public static java.awt.Graphics2D getGraphics()
        The graphics object that gets drawn to the front buffer.
        Use this for rendering.
        Returns:
        The Graphics2D object used to render to the screen.

      • getAudioContext

        public static net.beadsproject.beads.core.AudioContext getAudioContext()
        The main audio context used to process all sounds.
        Use this to play and process sounds.
        Returns:
        the AudioContext object used to process and play sounds.

      • getRobot

        public static java.awt.Robot getRobot()
        Returns:
        The robot that is attributed to the current screen and display.

      • isResizable

        public static boolean isResizable()
        Returns:
        Whether or not the native window can be resized.

      • setResizable

        public static void setResizable(boolean b)
        Sets whether or not the native window can be resized or not.
        Parameters:
        b -

      • isVisible

        public static boolean isVisible()
        Returns:
        Whether or not the native window is visible.

      • setVisible

        public static void setVisible(boolean b)
        Sets whether or not the native window is visible.
        Parameters:
        b -

      • outputToFile

        public static void outputToFile(java.io.File outputLocation,
                                boolean renderToScreen)
        Outputs frame pixels to JPG files in the desired location.
        Parameters:
        outputLocation - Location to place frame images.
        renderToScreen - Whether or not the screen should render

      • outputToFile

        public static void outputToFile(boolean renderToScreen)

      • isCloseRequested

        public static boolean isCloseRequested()
        Whether or not the user tried to close the display.
        Returns:
        true when the user attempts to close the display.

      • wasResized

        public static boolean wasResized()
        Whether or not the display window was resized since the last update.
        Returns:
        true if the native window was resized since the last update.

      • setTitle

        public static void setTitle(java.lang.String s)
        Sets the title of the display. This will appear on the top strip.
        Parameters:
        s - The title that the display will show.

      • grabFocus

        public static void grabFocus()

      • update

        public static void update()
        Update the window. Calls swapBuffers() and finally polls the input devices.
        See Also:
        pollInput(), swapBuffers()

      • sync

        public static void sync(double fps)
        An accurate sync method that will attempt to run at a constant frame rate. It should be called once every frame.
        Parameters:
        fps - The desired frame rate, in frames per second.

      • processDisplayEvents

        public static void processDisplayEvents()
        Receives and polls new input events. This method is called from update(), so it is not necessary to call this method if update() is called periodically.
        See Also:
        update()

      • swapBuffers

        public static void swapBuffers()
        Swap the display buffers. This method is called from update(), so it is not necessary to call this method if update() is called periodically.
        See Also:
        update()

      • destroy

        public static void destroy()
        Closes the window.

      • getWidth

        public static int getWidth()
        Returns:
        The width of the drawing area of the window.

      • getHeight

        public static int getHeight()
        Returns:
        The height of the drawing area of the window.

      • getFrameCount

        public static long getFrameCount()
        Returns:
        The number of frames that have been drawn.
